meta.idea_summary: SAMPLE: Retrieved abstract reasoning skeletons to improve small-model reasoning accuracy and efficiency.

research_question.rq: SAMPLE: Do retrieved abstract reasoning skeletons improve small-model reasoning accuracy under matched token budgets?
research_question.scope: SAMPLE: Math + coding reasoning tasks; retrieval from a library of abstracted traces.

novelty.positioning: SAMPLE: Retrieve compressed reasoning structure (not full demonstrations) to reduce token usage while improving accuracy.

duplicate_risk.why: SAMPLE: Overlaps with retrieval-augmented demonstrations and rationale distillation.
duplicate_risk.mitigation: SAMPLE: Emphasize abstraction rules, token-budget-matched controls, and latency wins with small models.

contributions: SAMPLE: A method to abstract reasoning traces into reusable skeletons and retrieve them per instance.
SAMPLE: Token-budget-matched evaluation showing accuracy/latency tradeoffs.
SAMPLE: A confound-controlled study separating retrieval benefit from length and oracle effects.

hypotheses.statement: IF retrieved skeletons are relevant THEN accuracy improves UNDER matched output token budgets COMPARED TO vanilla SLM.
hypotheses.failure_interpretation: If not, retrieval is not providing actionable structure beyond noise or length.

top3.name: Token-budget-matched main comparison
top3.purpose: Disentangle retrieval benefit from length/compute confounds.
top3.expected_outcomes: retrieved_skeleton > random_skeleton and retrieved_skeleton >= vanilla under same token budget.
top3.interpretation_rules: If retrieved_skeleton only wins when allowed longer outputs, treat as length confound.

single_best.name: Token-budget-matched main comparison
single_best.purpose: Single most decisive test for the core claim.
single_best.expected_outcomes: retrieved_skeleton improves accuracy at equal or lower token usage.
single_best.interpretation_rules: If no improvement, pivot to better abstraction or retrieval.

risks.why_it_matters: Longer prefixes or outputs can inflate accuracy without real reasoning improvement.
risks.mitigation: Token-budget matching and length-matched random prefix controls.

top_tier_simulation.decision: SAMPLE: borderline accept with strong controls and clear efficiency wins

title_candidates: SAMPLE: Retrieved Reasoning Skeletons for Efficient Small-Model Reasoning

outline.introduction: SAMPLE: problem, gap, contributions, summary of results (numbers).
outline.method: SAMPLE: abstraction + embedding + retrieval + prefixing procedure.
outline.experiments: SAMPLE: datasets, baselines, metrics, results, ablations, efficiency.

claim_registry.claim_text: SAMPLE: Retrieved skeletons improve accuracy under matched token budgets.

figure_table_plan: Table 1: Main accuracy + tokens + latency (token-budget matched).
Table 2: Ablations: random skeleton, retrieval quality, skeleton length.
Figure 1: Accuracy vs tokens tradeoff curve.
limitations: SAMPLE: May not generalize beyond selected benchmarks.
SAMPLE: Retrieval quality depends on skeleton library coverage.

assumptions.assumption: SAMPLE: Access to a strong LLM to generate reasoning traces.
SAMPLE: Benchmark licenses allow this usage.
